intro: Galium karakulense, commonly known as Karakul silverweed, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers in late summer, which are followed by small, berry-like fruits. Galium karakulense is adapted to harsh, alpine environments and thrives in well-drained soils. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in rocky and arid habitats.
